author: Mohamed Oumoumad
description: Render a comp from an AE project file

params.name: aerender executer
params.default: C:\Program Files\Adobe\Adobe After Effects CC 2017\Support Files\aerender.exe
params.tooltip: the path to your aerender executable, if you already have it in your PATH environement variable, then just put 'aerender'

params.name: Comp name
params.tooltip: input the name of the composition you want to render

params.name: Start frame
params.tooltip: input the frame you want to start rendering from, if left empty, the composition work area will be used

params.name: End frame
params.tooltip: input the frame you want to end the rendering at, if left empty, the composition work area will be used

params.name: frame increment
params.tooltip: input the template name for the render settings

params.name: Render settings
params.tooltip: the number of frames to advance before rendering a new frame

params.name: Output Module
params.tooltip: input the template name for the output module

params.name: Output name
params.tooltip: input the name of the rendered file(s)

params.name: Output directory
params.tooltip: you can choose another directory to put the output file on, '[projectFolder]' represents the project file's directory

params.name: use current AE instance
params.tooltip: when checked aerender will render the project using the already opened AE instance, otherwise it will open a new instance
